problem.markdown:
We often get questions about which types of work count as Core Contributor work. There is admittedly a blurry line at times, but often it is very clear.
>>Which of the following would count as valid Core Contributor hours? <<
[x] Doing prep work for a Working Group meeting [x] Attending a Working Group meeting, or catching up on a meeting (via recording or notes) if you can't attend synchronously [x] Performing follow-up work from a Working Group meeting [ ] Writing code for my company's client [x] Writing code that is being submitted upstream [ ] Meetings within my company's team about projects our company is working on [x] Answering questions on the Open edX forums [ ] Giving a tech talk to my team [x] Recording a tech talk on a topic relevant to some part of the community, and posting it for the greater community to see [x] 1-1/synchronous collaboration time with other community members on work you're doing together [ ] Performing code review for pull requests in your company's forks of the Open edX repositories [x] Performing code review for pull requests in the upstream openedx/ org github repositories for repos you're a core contributor on [x] Performing code review for pull requests in the upstream openedx/ org github repositories for repos you're not a core contributor on
